tasks.task: Measure sunflower height and collect seed heads. Subtasks: Find a mature sunflower, measure height from ground to head (98 cm +3). Wait until petals have fallen and seeds are visible. Remove seed head if possible, using scissors if necessary. Count seed spirals in two directions (clockwise and counterclockwise), using a starting point (e.g., zero) and counting from center outwards. Confirm the Fibonacci sequence (34 spirals) on this sunflower. MAINTASK: Count green brackets on the back of the sunflower head. Subtasks: Measure remaining green bracts around the base once the head is off. Otherwise, note their absence if moldy. MAINTASK: Document spiral counts visually or with digital tools. Subtasks: Take photos of seed heads for later analysis or use software to draw spirals for accurate counts.

subtasks: - [SUBTASK] Inspect sunflower for seed maturation (no yellow petals, seed visibility).
- [SUBTASK] Measure height from ground to seed head (e.g., 1m 20cm).
- [SUBTASK] Use tools (e.g., scissors) to remove the seed head carefully.
- [SUBTASK] Count spirals in multiple directions (e.g., clockwise and counterclockwise) starting from a reference point (e.g., zero, 34 in one direction).
- [SUBTASK] Confirm counts using visual aids from photos or software.
- [SUBTASK] Assess the presence and number of green bracts around the seed head. Note absence if moldy.

tasks.task: Measure sunflower height and collect seed head.
subtasks: Identify mature sunflower (no yellow petals, seeds visible).
Measure height from ground to center of head (e.g., 1m 20cm).
Carefully remove seed head (use tools if needed).
Count spirals in two directions (e.g., 34 and another number, both Fibonacci).
Check for presence and count if intact; note absence if moldy (as in this case).
Take photos or make detailed notes for analysis.

tasks.task: **MAINTASK: Measure and count sunflower seed spirals**

These tasks emphasize precision in data collection for botanical research.
